title: Abhijeet Bhattacharya says Mahatma Gandhi was the father of the nation for Pakistan, not India: 'RD Burma - TOI Etimes
summary:
Abhijeet Bhattacharya says Mahatma Gandhi was the father of the nation for Pakistan, not India: 'RD Burman was bigger than Gandhi'

Publication Date: [Insert date here] Source: Times of India

In a controversial statement, singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya declares that Mahatma Gandhi is regarded as the father of the nation in Pakistan rather than in India, while asserting that music composer RD Burman was a more significant figure than Gandhi.

  • Bhattacharya emphasizes the perception of Gandhi in Pakistan.
  • He compares Gandhi's legacy to that of RD Burman, suggesting Burman's cultural impact was greater.
  • The comments have generated debate regarding Gandhi's legacy in India and Pakistan.
'RD Burman was bigger than Gandhi.'

This statement raises questions about the cultural and historical narratives surrounding these iconic figures, prompting discussions among fans and scholars alike.

title: 'Worst night of my life': Woman rants about 'disaster' experience at Diljit Dosanjh concert - Hindustan Times
Allu Arjun's Hyderabad house vandalised by protesters protesters over Pushpa 2 stampede case - Hindustan Times
summary:
Allu Arjun's Hyderabad House Vandalised by Protesters Over 'Pushpa 2' Stampede

Date: Dec 22, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

On Sunday, protesters vandalised Allu Arjun's Hyderabad home, demanding compensation for victims of a recent stampede linked to the premiere of his film 'Pushpa 2'.

  • Protesters, identifying as OU JAC, vandalised the property in Jubilee Hills.
  • They demanded ₹1 crore for the family of a stampede victim.
  • The protest included pelting stones and breaking flower pots.
  • Eight individuals were arrested at the scene by police.
  • The incident stemmed from a previous stampede at a film premiere that resulted in one death.
“We demand that Allu Arjun take care of the late Revathi’s family. Why did so many film personalities visit him when he came out of jail after being there for 6 months, but none of them cared when a woman died.” - Protester

The tensions between Allu Arjun's fans and the protesters highlight broader issues surrounding celebrity accountability in tragic events.
newTitle: Allu Arjun's Hyderabad House Vandalised by Protesters Over 'Pushpa 2' Stampede

title: Allu Arjun's Hyderabad house vandalised by protesters demanding money for Pushpa 2 stampede victim's family - Hindustan Times

Protesters from the OU JAC vandalised Allu Arjun's house, demanding he pay ₹1 crore to the family of a stampede victim during the Pushpa 2 premiere.

title: Tomotoes Thrown, Protest Outside Allu Arjun's Home Over Stampede Death - NDTV
summary:
Protest Erupts Outside Allu Arjun's Home Following Stampede Tragedy

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A large protest occurred outside the residence of film actor Allu Arjun, ignited by a recent stampede at a movie premiere that resulted in a tragic death.

  • The protest was led by individuals claiming to be students from Osmania University.
  • During the protest, demonstrators threw tomatoes and damaged property.
  • The stampede incident happened on December 4 at Sandhya Theatre during the premiere of 'Pushpa 2'.
  • A woman died in the incident, and her eight-year-old son remains hospitalized in a coma.
  • Criticism has been directed at Allu Arjun for allegedly disregarding police orders at the event, which may have contributed to the chaos.
“He had even waved from his car's sun-roof on his way in and out, holding a roadshow of sorts and triggering a stampede-like situation.” - Chief Minister Revanth Reddy

The protest underscores public outrage over the handling of the premiere and the resulting tragedy, highlighting a need for accountability in event management.
newTitle: Protest Erupts Outside Allu Arjun's Home Following Stampede Tragedy

title: Pushpa 2 box office collection day 18 early report: Allu Arjun-starrer breaks Baahubali 2’s seven-year domestic record, takes pole position - The Indian Express
summary:
Pushpa 2 box office collection day 18 early report: Allu Arjun-starrer breaks Baahubali 2’s seven-year domestic record, takes pole position

Publication Date: December 5, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Pushpa 2 continues to break records, surpassing Baahubali 2's seven-year-old benchmark as the highest-grossing Indian film in the domestic market, marking a remarkable achievement for the film and its cast.

  • The film has crossed the Rs 1000 crore mark in the domestic market, becoming only the second film to do so after Baahubali 2.
  • Pushpa 2 has grossed over Rs 1500 crore globally, making it the highest-grossing film of 2024.
  • Early reports indicate the film earned Rs 22.7 crore on day 18, raising its total to Rs 1052.5 crore.
  • Despite its success, the film faces controversies due to a tragic incident during its premiere in Hyderabad.
“Pushpa 2 continues to mark its strong presence across the country.”

The phenomenal success of Pushpa 2 illustrates its significance in contemporary Indian cinema, reflecting both its popularity and the challenges faced due to surrounding controversies.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Breaks Box Office Record, Claims Top Spot in Indian Cinema

summary:

  • The film has sold around 5,300 tickets by 5 PM IST, grossing 18.70 lakh+ through advance bookings.

  • With around 2,500 shows currently scheduled, more are expected to be added soon, potentially boosting ticket sales.
  • Varun Dhawan's last release, Bhediya, had a day 1 advance booking of 1.85 crore gross.
“The film should ideally look to close its pre-sales at 6-7 crores.”

summary:
Mufasa: The Lion King Box Office Day 2 (India): Jumps By 52% But Lacks The Magic Of Its Predecessor

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Koimoi

The Lion King sequel/prequel, Mufasa: The Lion King, which hit screens recently, is experiencing a mixed box office performance, showing a 52% jump from its first day but still falling short of its predecessor’s success.

  • The film collected 9 crores on its release day.
  • On Day 2, it score reached 13.70 crores.
  • In total, it has earned 22.70 crores in India over two days.
  • The previous installment of The Lion King made 11.06 crores on its opening day and 30.21 crores over the same two days.
“It is now eyeing a debut between $33 and $37 million in North America, therefore losing the #1 spot to Sonic the Hedgehog 3.”

The performance is hampered in India due to competition from Pushpa 2 and upcoming releases, casting doubt on its longevity in theaters.
newTitle: Mufasa: The Lion King Box Office Day 2 Update

Mandira Bedi 'put down her head and cried’ after ‘disrespect’ shown by cricket legends when she hosted 2003 World Cup - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mandira Bedi recalls struggles as a cricket presenter during the 2003 World Cup

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Mandira Bedi recalls her challenging early days as a cricket presenter during the 2003 World Cup, emphasizing the scrutiny she faced as a woman in a male-dominated space.

  • Mandira started her career in the early 2000s as a cricket presenter.
  • Sharing her experience on Kareena Kapoor's show, she discussed the challenges she faced.
  • Facing criticism and skepticism from cricket legends, she struggled initially.
  • Over time, she gained confidence and demanded respect during her presentations.
  • Only Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi showed her respect out of the legends she worked with.
“At the end of every show, I would put my head down and cry. The legends on either side of me, I would ask them questions, and they just stared at me.”

Despite the initial disrespect, Mandira Bedi's journey highlights the evolving role of women in sports broadcasting.
newTitle: Mandira Bedi recalls struggles as a cricket presenter during the 2003 World Cup

  • The photo showcases the hands of Zakir Hussain, his wife, and daughters intertwined.
  • Zakir Hussain passed away at a San Francisco hospital due to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

“Gone but never forgotten,” an Instagram user commented, highlighting the legacy left behind by Zakir Hussain.

title: Vanvaas Box Office Collection Day 2: 39% Jump But No Relief, Will Nana Patekar’s Film Land In The List Of The Lowest Grossing Films Of 2024? - Koimoi
summary:
Vanvaas Box Office Collection Day 2: 39% Jump But No Relief

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 | Source: Koimoi

Nana Patekar and Utkarsh Sharma’s film Vanvaas has been struggling at the box office, earning only 1.75 crore in two days in India despite the weekend.

Key Points:

  • On the second day, the film’s earnings jumped 39% to 1.02 crore.
  • It opened as the 5th lowest grossing Hindi film in 2024.
  • The film needs to exceed the 5 crore mark to recover somewhat.
The film is already one of the lowest grossing films in Hindi at the box office in 2024.

The film's future looks bleak as Varun Dhawan's Baby John is set to release soon, potentially impacting its collections further.
newTitle: Vanvaas Box Office Collection Day 2: 39% Jump But No Relief

Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Day 17: Baahubali 2 Is Dethroned After 7 Years, Allu Arjun's Biggie Is Now #1 Indian Film In History! - Koimoi
summary:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Day 17: Baahubali 2 Is Dethroned After 7 Years, Allu Arjun’s Biggie Is No

Publication Date: December 17, 2024

Source: Koimoi

In a historic moment for Indian cinema, Allu Arjun’s Pushpa 2 has surpassed the lifetime collection of Baahubali 2, becoming the highest-grossing Indian film at the box office just 17 days after its release.

  • Pushpa 2 opened with a collection of 179.25 crores and reached 736.35 crores over its first 8 days.
  • After a record-breaking second week of 270.40 crores, the total collection reached 1006.75 crores.
  • On Day 17, the film earned 26 crores, bringing the total to 1046.75 crores net in India.
“Records are meant to be broken,” said industry insiders following the film's record-breaking performance.

Pushpa 2's success reflects its massive popularity, setting a new benchmark in the Indian film industry.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Dethrones Baahubali 2 at the Box Office

title: Weekly Horoscope: December 23rd to 29th, 2024 - The Times of India
summary:
Weekly Horoscope: December 23rd to 29th, 2024

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 Source: Delhi Times

Welcome to this week's horoscope, where the celestial alignments offer insight into the lives of the zodiac signs. From career and love to finances and health, these forecasts provide a glimpse into what the week holds for you.

  • Aries: Expect energy surges and surprises in personal and professional spheres.
  • Taurus: Steady progress is predicted with strong personal connections.
  • Gemini: Flexibility will be key as sudden changes disrupt your routine.
  • Cancer: Balance is crucial; opportunities may arise from long-pending matters.
  • Leo: Face key decisions and embrace positive news by the weekend.
  • Virgo: Family matters demand attention; clarity will emerge on key issues.
  • Libra: Resolve dilemmas in personal life through heartfelt conversations.
  • Scorpio: Emotional realizations will lead to decisive actions.
  • Sagittarius: Adaptability will bring new opportunities despite sudden plan changes.
  • Capricorn: New opportunities in personal and professional growth are on the horizon.
  • Aquarius: Communication and collaboration are key themes this week.
  • Pisces: Intuition will guide personal decisions alongside career recognition.

Overall, each zodiac sign can expect a week filled with potential, challenges, and opportunities guided by the stars.
